channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLmoneyAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My husband and I have $7K in Social Security and $2.5 million in stocks. What could go wrong?
item.description: “I hope to live off of the combination of Social Security and the TIPS ladder.”

item.title: My girlfriend, a widow in her 40s, pays off her credit card after every transaction. Is that weird?
item.description: “I saw her transfer $150 after we were done shopping.”

item.title: Retiring abroad is touted as a money saver — here’s why it isn’t always cheaper
item.description: Taxes, investments, healthcare — everything adds up. Here’s how to plan now to relocate later.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to worry about money’: I’m 64 with $400K in savings and $700 in Social Security. Can I retire next year?
item.description: “I take in about $2,200 in monthly rent from four properties.”

item.title: I’m planning to retire at 65 when my twins are 15. How will this impact their healthcare coverage?
item.description: “By retiring when they are in the 10th grade my income will be low when they apply for college scholarships.”
